A computational tool for studying structure and thermodynamics of water molecules on solute surfaces, developed at Kurtzman Lab.

SSTMap Solvation Structure and Thermodynamic Mapping

Examples of SSTMap Calculations

03 May 2017

The simplest way to run SSTMap is by its command-line tools; run_hsa and run_gist that provide side-based and grid-based calculations of solvation structure and thermodynamics. Here are some examples of running these tools on MD simulations generated by various packages.

It is assumed that an explicit solvent molecular dynamics trajectory has already been generated by the user in one of the MD simulation packages that are supported by MDTraj and ParEd. The repository sstmap_test_cases contains short trajectories of different systems generated by different packages, including Amber, Charmm, Desmond, Gromacs, NAMD and OpenMM.

Amber

$run_hsa -i testcase.prmtop -t testcase.nc -l ligand.pdb -s 0 -n 100 -o "testcase"

$run_gist -i testcase.prmtop -t testcase.nc -l ligand.pdb -s 0 -n 100 -d 20.0 20.0 20.0 -o "testcase"

Charmm

Desmond

Gromacs

NAMD

OpenMM
